isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Driver Controlled Main Differential Lock - INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL SHIFT ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Bolt On Type Shift Assembly
svcsubproc.para: Install the differential shift assembly after the differential carrier is assembled and the gear and bearing adjustments are made. The bolt on type shift assembly is shown in Figure 179.

figure.caption: Figure 179. Bolt On Type Shaft Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. FLAT WASHER OR SILASTIC AS REQUIRED

step1.para: Install the two roll pins into the ends of the shift fork. Tap the pins into position until they are even with the inner yoke face ( Figure 180).
If the spring stop roll pin was removed from the head of the shift shaft, re-install the pin at this time.
Apply Loctite 222 (Purple) (Rockwell Part No. 2297-B-6112) to the threads of the shift shaft.
Install the shift fork into its correct position in the carrier case ( Figure 181).
Hold the shift fork in position and install the shift shaft spring into the shift shaft opening in the carrier, through the shift fork bore and into the core for the shift shaft spring ( Figure 182).
Slide the shift shaft over the spring and install the shaft into the shift fork. Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 Nm) torque.
Install the copper gasket or apply silastic sealant Rockwell Part No. 1199-Q-2981 or Loctite 518 to the bottom of the cylinder bore ( Figure 183).
Install the O-ring into its groove on the piston. Lubricate the O-ring with axle lubricant. Carefully install the piston into the air cylinder ( Figure 183).

figure.caption: Figure 183. Install Gasket or Apply Silastic Sealant, and Install Piston

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. INSTALL FLAT WASHER OR APPLY SILASTIC SEALANT

step1.para: Install the cylinder into the housing bore. Make sure that the pilot journal on the piston is against its bore on the shift shaft ( Figure 184).

Install the copper gasket (if used) into its bore on the inside of the cylinder cover. Put the cover in position over the cylinder so that the air intake port will point up when the carrier is installed into the housing. Install the cover with the four attaching bolts and washers. Tighten to 4 to 6 ft-lbs. (5.5 to 8.5 Nm) ( Figure 185).
Apply a bead of silastic sealant Rockwell Part No. 1199-Q-2981 or Loctite 518 to the cylinder housing joint.

Slide the shift collar into the fork and engage the shift collar splines with the splines of the differential case. Use the manual actuation bolt to move the shift collar splines onto the differential case splines. Refer to Manual Engaging Method.
Hold the shift collar in the locked (engaged) position and tap in the two roll pins in the shift fork ends until they are even with the outer yoke faces ( Figure 186).
While the shift collar is still in the locked position, put the sensor switch (with the lock nut loosely attached) into its hole.

Connect a battery/bulb tester to the sensor switch and rotate the switch into its hole until contact with the shift fork causes the light to go on. Turn the switch one additional revolution and tighten the lock nut to 25 to 35 ft-lbs. (35 to 45 Nm).

note.para: For older model carriers without the differential lock (Less Air Shift), assemble the sensor switch plug and cover plate as follows:

item.para: Install the washer and plug into the hole for the sensor switch. Tighten the plug to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (60 to 74 Nm).
Apply silicone gasket material to the cover plate mounting surface in the carrier. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended gasket materials.
Install the four washers and bolts. Tighten the bolts to 4 to 6 ft-lbs. (5.5 to 8.5 Nm).

note.para: When the carrier is to be installed into the axle housing, the shift collar must be held in the engaged position. This can be done by keeping the air pressure applied to the shift cylinder, or by using the manual engaging bolt. Failure to keep the differential in the locked (engaged) position will make it impossible to install the carrier assembly into the axle housing. After the carrier is installed into the axle housing, shift the differential into the unlocked (disengaged) position to permit the installation of the left-hand axle shaft.

svcsubproc.title: Threaded Type Shift Assembly
svcsubproc.para: Install the differential shift assembly after the differential carrier is assembled and the gear and bearing adjustments are made. The threaded type shift assembly is shown in Figure 187.

step1.para: Install the shift fork into the shift tower of the carrier. The L shape of the fork and the bore for the shift shaft must face out toward the cylinder bore in the side of the carrier ( Figure 188).
Compress the shift shaft spring as required and install it between the back of the fork and carrier wall inside the shift tower ( Figure 189).
Align the spring and bore in the shift fork with the shift shaft bore in the carrier.
Install the shift shaft through the bore in the shift tower, fork and spring until it is against the shift fork ( Figure 190).
Install a new O-ring into the groove of the piston. Lubricate the O-ring with axle lubricant.
Install the piston and O-ring assembly into the shift cylinder, bevel end first. Push on the piston until it is against the bottom of the cylinder ( Figure 191).

figure.caption: Figure 191. Install Piston and O-Ring Assembly

step1.para: Install the shift cylinder and piston assembly into the bore of the shift tower. Turn the shift cylinder and piston assembly to the right until it bottoms in the bore ( Figure 192).

figure.caption: Figure 192. Install Shift Cylinder and Piston Assembly

step1.para: Position the shift collar over the fork. The large splines of the collar must face toward the main differential. Use a rubber mallet to tap the shift collar through the nubs of the shift fork ( Figure 193).

figure.caption: Figure 193. Position Shift Collar Over Fork

note.para: The seal must remain on the manual engaging bolt at all times.

step1.para: Engage the splines of the collar with the splines of the differential case. Insert the manual engaging bolt through the top of the shift cylinder to move the shift collar toward the differential case. Rotate the collar as necessary to align the splines ( Figure 194).

figure.caption: Figure 194. Rotate Collar as Necessary to Align Splines

step1.para: Turn the manual adjusting bolt to the right until the head is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover. DO NOT turn the bolt beyond its normal stop. The bolt is now in the service position and the main differential lock is completely engaged.

note.para: Failure to keep the differential in the locked position will make it impossible to install the axle shaft into the axle housing.

step1.para: While the shift collar is in the locked position, install the sensor switch into the threaded hole in the front of the shift tower ( Figure 195).

Connect a battery/bulb tester to the sensor switch. Rotate the switch into its hole until contact with the shift fork causes the light to go on. Turn the switch one additional revolution and tighten the lock nut to 25 to 35 ft-lbs. (35 to 45 Nm).
